desc.p: This field holds the capitalised interest amount for the trade underlying the record.
The number of the Security that this movement is associated with.
This field will contain the ID of the SECURITY.MASTER record that defines the security associated with the security movement that this SECURITY.TRANS record represents.
No input field, automatically updated by the system when the SECURITY.TRANS record is created.
Date settlement of cash/stock was reversed.
This field will contain the realised profit/loss, if any, in the portfolio reference currency as measured against the average cost of the security position.
Any amount reported here in respect of depository positions (suffixed "-999") should be ignored.
This is the currency of the security. It is the currency in which the security was issued and usually quoted.
It will default from the SECURITY.CURRENCY field of the SECURITY.MASTER record for the security in the SECURITY.NUMBER field.
No input field automatically updated by the system when the SECURITY.TRANS record is created.
This field contains the tax code that was used for calculating the CGT.
If the TAX record field LINK.TAX is populated then all linked tax codes will be shown.
The condition id allocated to this transaction relating to application CG.PARAM.CONDITION. This will determine the Capital Gains method and tax to be applied.
This field will contain the currency of the CG base amount on which the CGT was calculated.
Cost of investment in local currency.
Cost of investment in portfolio reference currency.
Manually entered tax amount trade currency.
Default dealer desk allocated to this transaction.
Customer tax amount in trade currency.
The field will hold the rate at which the Stock Borrow/ Lend transaction takes place.
This field is automatically updated if the ODD.LOT.CONSOLID field in CUSTOMER.SECURITY is set to NO and :
This field indicates the local currency equivalent Capital Gains Tax amount calculated.
If the TAX record, from the associated field CGT.TAX.CODE, field LINK.TAX is populated then all linked local tax amounts will be shown.
Customer tax amount in local currency.
Exchange rate local to trade currency
This field indicates the capital gains tax amount calculated.
If the TAX record, from the associated field CGT.TAX.CODE, field LINK.TAX is populated then all linked tax amounts will be shown.
The portfolio effected by the Security movement recorded in the SECURITY.TRANS record.

This will either be the portfolio ID, in which case it will be enriched from the SEC.ACC.MASTER record that defines the portfolio on T24 or be the depository record in which case it will contain XXXXXX-999, where XXXXXX is the Customer number of the depository and the suffix 999 defines that this is a depository record.
No input field, automatically updated by the system.
The Trade Date of the transaction that gave rise to the security movement represented by the SECURITY.TRANS record.
This is the date of the trade rather than the date the security position is credited or debited with the security - which is the value date.
No input field automatically updated by the system when the SECURITY.TRANS record is created.
If the security movement represented by this SECURITY.TRANS record is from/to a position that is held by nominee then this field will contain the Nominee Code of the the nominee.
Will exist on the NOMINEE.CODE file.
No input field automatically updated by the system from the transaction that created the SECURITY.TRANS record.
This indicates whether the tax is to be deducted by the bank (LOCAL) or the depositor (SOURCE).
The nominal of securities relating to this transaction that remain unsettled.
This is the ID of the T24 transaction that produced the security movement represented by the SECURITY.TRANS record.
From the suffix of the transaction ID the application can be identified and hence the original transaction enquired upon.
The following applications update the SECURITY.TRANS file. They can be identified from the following suffixes ;
BDRDSC - REDEMPTION.CUS CAPISC - CAPTL.INCREASE.CUS DIARSC - ENTITLEMENT POSTSC - POSITION.TRANSFER SCTRSC - SEC.TRADE SECTSC - SECURITY.TRANSFER STKDSC - STOCK.DIV.CUS
No input field automatically updated by the system when the SECURITY.TRANS record is created.
This field indicates the trade date & time recorded for the trade done. It is used in ordering the trades for the purposes of capital gains calculations.
This field contains the base amount on which the CGT is calculated.
This Issue Date of the security.
Will default from the ISSUE.DATE field on the SECURITY.MASTER record for the security.
No input field automatically updated when the SECURITY.TRANS record is created.

This field will hold the interest counter value arising from each transaction. Calculation will be performed in the same way it is performed for cost invested fields in SECURITY.TRANS and SECURITY.POSITION.
This field contains the gross cost of the transaction in portfolio reference currency.
Field indicating whether the transaction is for rounding of rights relating to a corporate action. This flag is determined by the system.
Exchange rate local to security currency
This field will contain the gross cost of the security transaction in local currency
Exchange rate local to account currency
This field contains the net cost of the transaction in security currency.
Manually entered tax amount local currency.
A maximum of 12 characters may be entered.
The PRICE.TYPE of the security in the SECURITY.NUMBER field of the SECURITY.TRANS record. Must exist on the PRICE.TYPE file.
The PRICE.TYPE file contains all the details of how the security price is quoted and the rules on its calculation - for example whether it is quoted as a percentage or not.
No input field automatically updated by the system when the SECURITY.TRANS record is created.
This field contains the sub-account of the security position updated by this securities transaction.
This sub account is defined in CUSTOMER.SECURITY record for this depository.
Exchange rate local to portfolio reference currency
Actual dealer desk that actioned the transaction.
New field containing the adjustment nominal.
The maturity date of the security.
Will be populated from the MATURITY.DATE field on the SECURITY.MASTER record for the security.
No input field automatically updated by the system when the SECURITY.TRANS record is created.

This field is used to capture the contract id of the parent transaction that created the child security transaction. This will be the Id of the parent application that then called the Composite Module Manager (CMM) to create the child security contract.
This field used in the calculation of consideration using the Columbian Yield Method.
This field will contain the net cost of the security transaction in the reference currency of the underlying portfolio.
Indicates Cum and Ex markers that have been applied to a transaction, currently available on SEC.TRADE and SECURITY.TRANSFER.
Depending on the settings on SM.PARAMETER and DIARY.TYPE, these markers may be used when calculating the portfolio holding entitled to a corporate event (DIARY/ENTITLEMENT).
Cost of investment in security currency.
The Depository to which the Securities will be delivered or from which they will be received.
Must be set-up on the CUSTOMER.SECURITY file as a Depository.
No input field, automatically updated by the system when the SECURITY.TRANS record is created.
This field is not normally updated by T24.

It is present to be used to update the SECURITY.TRANS record for auditing purposes is the SECURITY.TRANS file is rebuilt in some ad-hoc fashion. e.g. by Temenos staff correcting erroneous Security Positions.
To identify the external custodian where position is held..
This field indicates the tax rate that was used in the calculation of the CGT.
If the TAX record, from the associated field CGT.TAX.CODE, field LINK.TAX is populated then all linked tax rates will be shown.
The Value Date of the transaction that gave rise to the security movement represented by the SECURITY.TRANS record.
This is the date that the transaction is settled and hence the date that the portfolio will pay for or receive money for the securities.
No input field automatically updated by the system when the SECURITY.TRANS record is created.
The interest rate of the security.

Will be populated from the INTEREST.RATE field on the SECURITY.MASTER record for the security. As the INTEREST.RATE field is multi-valued this field will be populated from the interest rate current at the time of the security movement that gave rise to the SECURITY.TRANS record.
No input field automatically updated by the system when the SECURITY.TRANS record is created.
This field contains the net cost of the security transaction in the local currency.
This field contains the gross cost of the security transaction in the security currency.
This field is to determine whether the order is a parent order
This field will accept alphanumeric Value
Unique parent reference that is common for both parent and child orders and will serve as a link.
